channel.title: Paypal, Scammed again
channel.description:
This is the third time i have been "hacked" on paypal, sending lots of money to random shit emails..
I use different computers, keep up-to-date antivirus software etc etc.
I am thinkin i should just junk paypal and not bother, causes me more hassle than its worth..
I will get my money back, though i needed my money for friday (p.s. they withdrew $800 and made me go over my overdraft :(!)
What do you advise? i am re-formatting PC tomorrow, to be safe.
/rant

item.description:

[quote=“Owner Nader, post:9, topic:285280”][quote author=the fu superior link=topic=377023.msg2840305#msg2840305 date=1245933211]

Search for ‘’ Keylogger ‘’ in your comp if you see anything then dont login, Because keylogger is a hacker program, many using it to Hack rs accs but there are someone using it to hack paypals and this shit,

omg sauce?
[/quote]You Dont know that program?[/quote]You just made my day.

item.title: Paypal, Scammed again
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:15, topic:285280”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=377023.msg2840660#msg2840660 date=1245949580]

Install Linux.

I was on linux =/

The whole time? You never logged into paypal from windows at all?

Did you use the same password anywhere else?
[/quote]
There is keyloggers for Linux to, so you can be hacked there too.

sudo apt-get install keylogger[/quote]

The large and important difference being that any program you run on linux can’t go willy-nilly sniffing keys from you. It would need to be ran with root permissions, which isn’t going to happen on a well configured system. So a ‘linux virus’ can really do no harm to the actual system, only to things it has access to, which isn’t much.

Read full topic

item.title: Paypal, Scammed again
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:

Install Linux.
[/quote]

I was on linux =/

Im installing Windows 7 64bit ATM[/quote]
That’s just going to make it worse. Windows 7 is more insecure than any linux os.

Read full topic
